name: Raspado
description:
A raspado is an ice-based dessert made of fine shavings or finely crushed ice. Raspar is Spanish for "scrape"; hence raspado means "scraped", referring to the ice. Raspados come in a wide range of fruit flavors and classic Mexican flavors, including leche (sweetened milk with cinnamon), picosito (lemon and chili powder), chamoy (fruits and chili sauce, known as chamoyada), cucumber, guanabana, guava, pistachio, and tamarind.

In Puerto Rico, this shave iced deliciousness is called a piragua! [piˈɾa.ɣwa]! Piraguas are sold by vendors, known as piragüeros, from small colorful pushcarts.

In Costa Rica, it's named Copo, which in Spanish means “flake”! 

Art created by TecnoLatinx VR Artist: Steve Vazquez
